choices.D: The enrollment restriction for device DEP is set to Deny.
choices.B: The default profile assigned for newly synced devices is set to None.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: B
'From the Default Profile Assigned for Newly Synced Devices menu, select the DEP profile you want to
automatically assign to all devices upon being synced into Workspace ONE UEM. If you do not wish to push a DEP
profile to new devices, select None.'

questions.question_text:
A user has configured the Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) integration within Workspace ONE UEM. When the user is testing the integration, everything works fine with the test device. But, new devices are not automatically enrolled.
What is most likely the issue?
An administrator has added Workspace ONE content and no user can access that content right now. What could be the issue?

discussion.content: D. The availability date is set to far in the future.

choices.A: The download type is set to PUSH.
choices.B: The transfer method is set to ALL.
choices.C: The availability date is set to far in the past.
choices.D: The availability date is set to far in the future.

questions.question_text: Which minimum rights on a Certificate Authority (CA) should be assigned for the account specified in the CA definition in the UEM Console?

discussion.content:
Answer: B
Add a Service Account to the CA
"Step 9: Select the Read, the Issue and Manage Certificates, and the Request Certificates
checkboxes to assign permissions to the service account."
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1909/WS1_Certificate_Authority_Integrations.pdf (page 9, step 9)

It's B.
Select the:
Read 
Issue and Manage Certificates
the Request Certificates
checkboxes to assign permissions to the service account.

I would think it is B per the following: Select the Read, the Issue and Manage Certificates, and the Request Certificates check boxes to assign permissions to the service account. They should not need to Manage CA
Wrong, must be B : see page 14.

choices.B: Local admin on the CA server with the privileges: read, issue and manage certificates, request certificates permissions.
choices.C: Local admin on the CA server with the privileges: full access.
choices.A: Local admin on the CA server with the privileges: read, issue and manage certificates, manage CA, request certificates permissions.
choices.D: Local admin on the CA server with the privileges: read, manage certificates, manage CA, request certificates permissions.

questions.question_text:
A new organization policy requires multi-factor authentication for device enrollment, based on the network location of the device.
How should this be configured?

choices.C: Change the source of authentication for the Intelligent Hub to Identity Manager.
choices.B: Multi-factor authentication is not available for device enrollment in Workspace ONE.
choices.D: Enable the multi-factor option in the user settings.
choices.A: Enable multi-factor as the authentication model.

discussion.content:
I think, D is correct answer
Select the authentication method that the enrollment policy requires..To set up multi-factor authentication, click + and select the MFA method to use
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-Access/services/ws1_access_authentication_cloud/GUID-9B62FAF2-079D-4532-B17A-344F20237539.html
